sen.j: 松平 資訓（まつだいら すけくに）は、江戸時代の大名、京都所司代。
sen.e: Sukekuni MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) in the Edo period.
Sukekuni MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) in the Edo period.
Sukekuni MATSUDAIRA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 遠江国浜松藩第2代藩主、三河国三河吉田藩初代藩主、再封され浜松藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the second lord of the Hamamatsu Domain in Totomi Province, the first lord of the Mikawa-Yoshida domain in Mikawa Province, and then changed the territory back to become the first lord of the Hamamatsu Domain.

He was the second lord of the Hamamatsu Domain in Totomi Province, the first lord of the Mikawa-Yoshida Domain in Mikawa Province, and then changed the territory back to become the first lord of the Hamamatsu Domain.

He was the second lord of the Hamamatsu Domain in Totomi Province, the first lord of the Mikawa-Yoshida Domain in Mikawa Province, and then changed the territory back to become the first lord of the Hamamatsu Domain.
The third head of the Honjo matsudaira family.
The third head of the Honjo Matsudaira family.
The third head of the Honjo Matsudaira family.

sen.j: 大身旗本・佐野勝由の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) Katsuyoshi SANO.
He was born as the second son of a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) Katsuyoshi SANO.
He was born as the second son of a taishin hatamoto (greater vassal) Katsuyoshi SANO.

sen.j: 甥の松平宗弥が早世したため、浜松藩主・松平資俊の養子となり家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: Because his nephew Munemitsu MATSUDAIRA died young, he was adopted by the lord of the Hamamatsu domain Mototoshi MATSUDAIRA and took over as the head of the family.
Because his nephew Munemitsu MATSUDAIRA died young, he was adopted by the lord of the Hamamatsu Domain Suketoshi MATSUDAIRA and took over as the head of the family.
sen.cmt: Domain大文字にしました。Suketoshiに訂正しました。
sen.e: Because his nephew Munemitsu MATSUDAIRA died young, he was adopted by the lord of the Hamamatsu Domain Suketoshi MATSUDAIRA and took over as the head of the family.

sen.j: のち京都所司代を務め、幕政に参与した。
sen.e: Later, he served as Kyoto shoshidai and joined the shogunate government.
Later, he served as Kyoto shoshidai and joined the shogunate government.
Later, he served as Kyoto shoshidai and joined the shogunate government.

sen.j: 享保14年（1729年）：三河吉田城転封
sen.e: 1729: He changed the territory to Mikawa-Yoshida jo Castle.

sen.cmt: Mikawa Yoshida-jo Castleに訂正しました。

sen.j: 寛延2年（1749年）：京都所司代、遠江浜松城転封
sen.e: 1749: He became Kyoto shoshidai and changed the territory to Totoumi Hamamatsu-jo Castle.
